alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:11PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong storm will impact portions of west central Clackamas County through 245 PM PDT... At 209 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong storm over Molalla, or 14 miles south of Oregon City, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Molalla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills
